page.title: 04 FUNTINGTON CHURCH
page.content: The churchyard is entered through a lych gate made of wood.The 3 acre church site includes a graveyard with 598 gravestones.The vicar's sheep graze there.The door of the church is covered with wire netting to stop the birds flying in.Laburnum,elderberry, yew,copper beach and bay trees grow around the church.The building is in good repair after raising Â£1500 in a fete in 1984.There are 3 bells which are plucked like a harp by 3 ropes in the vestry.A stained glass window recently repaired cost Â£900.There are no services during the week.A Sunday School is held in West Ashling village hall.The congregation averages 40.Rev. Johnson,the vicar,is also vicar of West Stoke and Sennicotts.
